metadata.Title: CVE-2021-28861 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** Python 3.x through 3.10 has an open redirection vulnerability in lib/http/server.py due to no protection against multiple (/) at the beginning of URI path which may leads to information disclosure. NOTE: this is disputed by a third party because the http.server.html documentation page states "Warning: http.server is not recommended for production. It only implements basic security checks."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28861` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm5
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm5
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm5
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm5
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm5
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm5
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm5
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm5
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python3.5 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm5').
